title: Hardtails Have More Fun: Salsa’s 2025 Rangefinder and Timberjack
content:
Salsa has some new builds and colors for its 2025 entry-level Rangefinder and Alternator 2.0 dropout-equipped Timberjack hardtails…

Rangefinder

Think of the Rangefinder hardtail as the ideal starter mountain bike. If you’ve got the MTB itch, Rangefinder lets you explore where the dirt can take you without burning through your budget.

2025 Rangefinder Builds range from $899 for Advent X 29 through $1499 for Deore 12 29er

  • Entry-level geometry for a confident, secure riding position
  • 120mm fork
  • Cargo mounts for off-road adventures
  • Entry-level price point, starting at $1000

Timberjack

While the Timberjack hardtail has a slightly more progressive geometry and Alternator dropouts for singlespeed riding and slight geometry tweaks.

2025 Timberjack builds range from SLX 29 for $1699 up through XT 29 $2899.

  • Progressive, slightly more modern trail geometry for taking on bigger trail obstacles
  • 140mm fork
  • Cargo mounts for off-road adventures
  • Versatile, adjustable Alternator 2.0 dropouts

 

Check these out in person at your local Salsa dealer.
